db:abstract.db:para: A request for providing authentication credentials required by proxies or HTTP servers.
This type was introduced in QtWebEngine 1.4.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: An AuthenticationDialogRequest is passed as an argument of the WebEngineView::authenticationDialogRequested signal. It is generated when basic HTTP or proxy authentication is required. The type of authentication can be checked with the type property.

The accepted property of the request indicates whether the request is handled by the user code or the default dialog should be displayed. If you set the accepted property to true, make sure to call either dialogAccept() or dialogReject() afterwards.
The following code uses a custom dialog to handle the request:

db:section.db:title: accepted : bool
db:section.db:para: Indicates whether the authentication dialog request has been accepted by the signal handler.

If the property is false after any signal handlers for WebEngineView::authenticationDialogRequested have been executed, a default authentication dialog will be shown. To prevent this, set request.accepted to true.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] proxyHost : string
db:section.db:para: The hostname of the authentication proxy. Empty if type is AuthenticationTypeHTTP.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] realm : string
db:section.db:para: The HTTP authentication realm attribute value of the WWW-Authenticate header. Empty if type is AuthenticationTypeProxy.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] type : enumeration
db:section.db:para: The type of the authentication request.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] url : url
db:section.db:para: The URL of the HTTP request for which authentication was requested. In case of proxy authentication, this is a request URL which is proxied via host.

db:section.db:title: void dialogAccept(string username, string password)
db:section.db:para: This function notifies the engine that the user accepted the dialog, providing the username and the password required for authentication.

db:section.db:title: void dialogReject()
db:section.db:para: This function notifies the engine that the user rejected the dialog and the authentication shall not proceed.
